item.title: 莱茵金属公司首席执行官向德国电视台表示，希望到 2030 年销售额达到 500 亿欧元
item.description: 莱茵金属公司首席执行官 Armin Papperger 周二在接受 RTL 和 NTV 广播公司采访时表示，莱茵金属公司力争到 2030 年实现 400 亿至 500 亿欧元（590 亿美元）的销售额。【原文：Rheinmetall is seeking to reach sales of between 40 and 50 billion euros ($59 billion) by 2030, CEO Armin Papperger told broadcasters RTL and NTV in an interview published on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道Grammarly 收购电子邮件初创公司 Superhuman，推动人工智能平台发展
item.description: Grammarly 的高管在接受路透社采访时表示，Grammarly 已经收购了电子邮件效率工具 Superhuman，这是该公司打造人工智能驱动的生产力套件和实现业务多元化的努力的一部分。【原文：Grammarly has acquired email efficiency tool Superhuman as part of the company's push to build an artificial intelligence-powered productivity suite and diversify its business, its executives told Reuters in an interview.】

item.title: 全球经济基础不稳，贝莱德着眼于短期押注
item.description: 贝莱德投资研究所（BII）周二表示，在全球经济前景日益不明朗的情况下，传统上稳定的长期经济趋势的不确定性日益增加，促使其转向短期策略。【原文：The BlackRock Investment Institute (BII) said on Tuesday that growing uncertainty around traditionally stable, long-term economic trends is pushing it toward shorter-term strategies amid an increasingly unclear global economic outlook.】

item.title: M&S 首席执行官：网络攻击的大部分影响将在八月前消除
item.description: 马莎百货公司首席执行官斯图尔特-麦金（Stuart Machin）在周二举行的零售商年度股东大会上告诉股东们，四月份马莎百货公司遭受的网络攻击的大部分影响将在八月份之前消除。【原文：Most of the impact of the cyberattack which hit Marks & Spencer M&S in April will be behind it by August, Chief Executive Stuart Machin told shareholders at the retailer's annual general meeting on Tuesday.】

item.title: 洞察力：稀土磁铁用户被迫为中国以外的供应支付高价
item.description: 多年来，拉希姆-苏莱曼（Rahim Suleman）多次联系汽车制造商和其他潜在客户，推销他的公司在爱沙尼亚建设的工厂生产的稀土磁铁。【原文：For years, Rahim Suleman had reached out repeatedly to automakers and other potential clients to market the rare earth magnets from the plant his company was building in Estonia, one of just a handful outside dominant producer China.】

item.title: 早间竞标参议院投票大戏继续上演
item.description: 本文仅代表欧洲、中东和非洲地区《金融市场》编辑 Dhara Ranasinghe 的观点。【原文：The opinions expressed here are those of Dhara Ranasinghe, Editor, Financial Markets, EMEA.】

item.title: 投资者关注特朗普的税收法案，期货价格在创下历史新高后下跌
item.description: 继华尔街股指创下历史新高之后，美国股市期货周二下跌，原因是投资者在关注美国贸易谈判以及参议院就唐纳德-特朗普总统的税收和支出法案进行的马拉松式投票。【原文：U.S. stock futures dipped on Tuesday, following a record run for Wall Street indexes, as investors monitored U.S. trade talks and a Senate voting marathon over President Donald Trump's tax and spending bill.】

item.title: 美国第二季度汽车销量将增长，关税可能推高价格
item.description: 在持续需求的推动下，美国汽车销量在第二季度将有所增长，但业内专家预测，唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税政策将在未来几个月给汽车价格带来压力。【原文：U.S. auto sales are set to rise in the second quarter aided by sustained demand, but industry experts forecast President Donald Trump's tariffs to pressure prices in the months ahead.】

item.title: 独家新闻： 消息人士称，DOGE 目前正瞄准 SEC 政策，关注 SPAC 规则
item.description: 据两位熟知内情的人士透露，唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府效率部倡议推动美国市场监督机构放松华尔街有关空白支票公司和私人投资基金保密报告的规定。【原文：President Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency initiative has pushed the U.S. markets watchdog to loosen Wall Street rules around blank-check companies and confidential reporting by private investment funds, according to two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 诺和诺德如何误读美国市场对其减肥药的需求
item.description: 参与讨论的六名前员工告诉路透社记者，诺和诺德公司的高管们忽视了内部警告，即该公司没有为其减肥药 Wegovy 的上市做好充分准备，导致这家丹麦制药商在竞争对手礼来公司进入市场时处于更加脆弱的境地。【原文：Novo Nordisk's top executives ignored internal warnings that the company was not sufficiently prepared for the launch of its weight-loss drug Wegovy, leaving the Danish drugmaker in a more vulnerable position when rival Eli Lilly entered the market, six former employees involved in the discussions told Reuters.】

item.title: Cloudflare 推出工具，帮助网站所有者实现人工智能机器人爬虫访问货币化
item.description: Cloudflare 软件公司周二表示，该公司已推出一款工具，阻止机器人爬虫未经许可或补偿访问内容，以帮助网站从试图访问和训练其内容的人工智能公司那里赚钱。【原文：Cloudflare has launched a tool that blocks bot crawlers from accessing content without permission or compensation to help websites make money from AI firms trying to access and train on their content, the software company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 受大型 IPO 的推动，纳斯达克上半年上市数量超过纽交所
item.description: 2025 年上半年，纳斯达克在股票市场上市方面轻松击败了纽约证券交易所，这主要得益于 CoreWeave 和 Chime 等大公司的巨额首次公开募股，以及特殊目的收购公司募集资金的猛增。【原文：Nasdaq handily beat the New York Stock Exchange in stock market listings during the first half of 2025, buoyed by blockbuster initial public offerings of big names like CoreWeave and Chime and a jump in proceeds raised via special purpose acquisition companies.】

item.title: 2025年下半年伊始，美股投资者面临六大问题
item.description: 美国股市在今年上半年完成了过山车式的上涨，创下历史新高，但在 2025 年余下的时间里，一系列因素可能会使股市跌落谷底。【原文：The U.S. stock market completed a roller-coaster first half of the year at record-high levels but a host of factors could knock equities off their perch over the rest of 2025.】

item.title: 花旗集团聘请前野村资深人士清田和内部人士长坂为日本投资银行联席主管
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc）周二表示，已从野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc）聘请资深投资银行家清田彰（Akira Kiyota），并提拔内部人士长坂泰治（Taiji Nagasaka）担任日本投资银行业务联席主管。【原文：Citigroup Inc has hired veteran investment banker Akira Kiyota from Nomura Holdings Inc and promoted insider Taiji Nagasaka as co-heads of investment banking for Japan, it said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，欧盟希望在任何美国贸易协定中为关键行业提供先期救济
item.description: 欧盟外交官告诉路透社记者，欧盟希望在 7 月 9 日截止日期前与美国达成的任何贸易协议中立即减免关键行业的关税，但欧盟预计即使是最好的协议也会包含一定程度的不对称。【原文：The European Union wants immediate relief from tariffs in key sectors as part of any trade deal with the United States due by a July 9 deadline, but the bloc expects even a best-case deal to include a degree of asymmetry, EU diplomats told Reuters.】

item.title: 特斯拉季度交付量再次下降
item.description: 由于对首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）政治观点的反弹和竞争压力继续拖累需求，特斯拉预计将于周三公布季度交付量再次下降的报告。【原文：Tesla is expected to report another fall in quarterly deliveries on Wednesday as the backlash against CEO Elon Musk's political views and competitive pressures continue to drag on demand.】

item.title: 欧元区通胀回升至欧洲央行目标
item.description: 欧元区上个月的通胀率略有上升，达到了欧洲央行 2% 的目标，这证明物价飞涨的时代已经过去，决策者的注意力也转移到了贸易战引发的经济波动上。【原文：Euro zone inflation edged up last month to the European Central Bank's 2% target, confirming that the era of runaway prices is over and shifting policymaker focus to trade war-induced economic volatility.】

item.title: 迪拜希望通过 2026 年 Joby 空中出租车的升空来缓解交通压力
item.description: 迪拜通勤者可能很快就会有一种跳过交通堵塞的新方式：空中出租车。【原文：Dubai commuters may soon have a new way to skip traffic: air taxis.】

item.title: 美国参议院否决特朗普巨额法案中的人工智能监管禁令
item.description: 共和党领导的美国参议院周二以压倒性票数通过了特朗普总统的减税和支出法案，取消了为期 10 年的联邦暂停各州监管人工智能的规定。【原文：The Republican-led U.S. Senate voted overwhelmingly on Tuesday to remove a 10-year federal moratorium on state regulation of artificial intelligence from President Trump's sweeping tax-cut and spending bill.】

item.title: 意大利莱昂纳多公司收购芬兰 SSH 公司股份，成为其最大股东
item.description: 意大利莱昂纳多公司（Leonardo）周二宣布，将收购芬兰 SSH 公司 24.55% 的股份，成为后者最大的股东，并通过这一新的战略合作伙伴关系拓展其网络安全业务。【原文：Italy's Leonardo will buy a 24.55% stake in Finland's SSH , making it the latter's biggest shareholder as it expands its cyber security business with this new strategic partnership, the companies announced on Tuesday.】

item.title: 中国准备在世贸组织与美国讨论关税和补贴问题
item.description: 中国驻世界贸易组织代表团的一位高级代表说，中国已准备好就包括关税和补贴在内的贸易政策展开讨论，华盛顿认为这些政策是世界贸易组织改革的障碍。【原文：China is ready to have discussions about trade policies, including tariffs and subsidies, that Washington has identified as obstacles to reforming the World Trade Organization, a senior delegate at China's mission to the WTO said.】

item.title: 特斯拉在瑞典和丹麦的销量下降超过 60
item.description: 6 月份，特斯拉在瑞典和丹麦的销量连续第六个月下滑，这凸显了这家电动汽车制造商面临的挑战，因为竞争对手的市场份额不断扩大，首席执行官埃隆-马斯克的声望也在下降。【原文：Tesla's sales dropped for a sixth straight month in Sweden and Denmark in June, underscoring the challenges the EV-maker faces as competitors gain market share and CEO Elon Musk's popularity declines.】

item.title: 雅各布斯咖啡制造商 JDE Peet's 发布品牌主导战略，制定中期目标
item.description: 咖啡和茶叶公司 JDE Peet's 周二公布了一项新战略，旨在新任首席执行官的领导下简化产品组合和组织模式。【原文：Coffee and tea company JDE Peet's unveiled a new strategy on Tuesday that aims to simplify its portfolio and organizational model under its new CEO.】

item.title: 美国初创企业 Lyten 将接管 Northvolt 在波兰的储能系统工厂
item.description: 硅谷初创公司 Lyten 周二表示，将全资收购欧洲最大的储能系统工厂 Northvolt Dwa ESS，以扩大其产品线。【原文：Silicon Valley startup Lyten will take full ownership of Northvolt Dwa ESS, Europe’s largest energy storage systems factory, in a move to expand its product line, the U.S. company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 小米 YU7 汽车购买者面临长达一年的交付等待，引发投诉
item.description: 中国的小米公司告诉新款 YU7 电动运动型多用途车的客户，他们需要等待一年多才能收到车，这引发了针对该公司的新一轮投诉。【原文：China's Xiaomi is telling customers of its new YU7 electric sports utility vehicle they will have to wait more than a year to receive their cars, sparking a fresh wave of complaints against the company.】

item.title: 丹麦 6 月特斯拉注册量同比下降 61.6
item.description: 丹麦移动通信公司（Mobility Denmark）周二提供的注册数据显示，特斯拉 6 月份在丹麦的新车注册量比去年同期下降了 61.57%，为 1282 辆。【原文：Tesla's registration of new cars in Denmark fell by 61.57% in June from the same month a year ago to 1,282 vehicles, registration data from Mobility Denmark showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 马来西亚数据中心与更高的电力成本和不明确的定价作斗争
item.description: 业内人士表示，在本周二开始实施比预期更高的电费之后，马来西亚高能耗数据中心的运营商们正争先恐后地重新评估成本，这给这个东南亚数字投资中心的前景蒙上了一层阴影。【原文：The operators of energy-hungry data centres in Malaysia are scrambling to reassess costs after steeper-than-expected power tariffs kicked in on Tuesday, industry players said, clouding prospects for the Southeast Asian hub of digital investments.】

item.title: 中国长江三角洲地区的汽车经销商警告 "严峻挑战
item.description: 中国最富裕地区之一的汽车经销商正在呼吁汽车制造商彻底改革销售策略，因为他们面临的现金流压力越来越大，库存也越来越高，这再次表明全球最大汽车市场的价格战正在造成越来越大的损失。【原文：Car dealers in one of China's richest regions are appealing to automakers to overhaul sales strategies amid mounting pressure on their cash flow and high inventories in another sign of the growing toll of the price war in the world's largest car market.】

item.title: 两家中国芯片公司计划首次公开募股 17 亿美元，押注美国出口限制将刺激增长
item.description: 两家中国人工智能芯片初创企业的申报文件显示，它们正寻求在首次公开募股中合计融资120亿元人民币（16.5亿美元），希望美国抑制对华先进芯片销售的措施能促进当地对其产品的需求。【原文：Two Chinese artificial intelligence chip startups are seeking to raise a combined 12 billion yuan ($1.65 billion) in initial public offerings, hoping U.S. curbs on advanced chip sales to China will boost local demand for their products, their filings show.】

item.title: 参议院为通过特朗普 3.3 万亿美元议案的投票活动进入第二天
item.description: 美国参议院共和党人在周二凌晨仍在努力通过唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的全面减税和支出法案，尽管党内对该法案预计将对国家债务造成 3.3 万亿美元的冲击存在分歧。【原文：U.S. Senate Republicans in the early hours of Tuesday morning were still trying to pass President Donald Trump's sweeping tax-cut and spending bill, despite divisions within the party about its expected $3.3 trillion hit to the nation's debt pile.】
